lessons.title: Saying Hello
lessons.targetText: Hello! My name is... Nice to meet you!
lessons.culturalNote: Americans often use informal greetings like "Hey" with friends.
lessons.practiceDialogue: A: Hello! My name is Sarah. B: Hi Sarah! Nice to meet you. I'm Mike.

lessons.title: Asking How Someone Is
lessons.targetText: How are you? I'm fine, thank you. And you?
lessons.culturalNote: "How are you?" is often a greeting, not a real question.
lessons.practiceDialogue: A: How are you doing? B: I'm doing great, thanks! How about you?

lessons.title: Saying Goodbye
lessons.targetText: Goodbye! See you later! Take care!
lessons.culturalNote: Americans often say "See ya!" as an informal goodbye.
lessons.practiceDialogue: A: I have to go now. B: Okay, see you later! Take care!

lessons.title: Morning Activities
lessons.targetText: I wake up at 7 AM. I brush my teeth and eat breakfast.
lessons.culturalNote: Many Americans drink coffee with breakfast.
lessons.practiceDialogue: A: What time do you wake up? B: I usually wake up at 7.

lessons.title: Work and School
lessons.targetText: I go to work at 9 AM. I work until 5 PM.
lessons.culturalNote: The typical American workday is 9 to 5.
lessons.practiceDialogue: A: Where do you work? B: I work at a bank downtown.

lessons.title: At the Store
lessons.targetText: How much does this cost? Can I pay by card?
lessons.culturalNote: Credit cards are widely accepted in the US.
lessons.practiceDialogue: A: How much is this shirt? B: It's $25. A: I'll take it.

lessons.title: Email Writing
lessons.targetText: Dear Mr. Smith, I am writing to inquire about...
lessons.culturalNote: American business emails are often more direct than in other cultures.
lessons.practiceDialogue: Writing a professional email requesting information.

lessons.title: Expressing Opinions
lessons.targetText: In my opinion... I believe that... On the other hand...
lessons.culturalNote: Americans value direct but respectful disagreement.
lessons.practiceDialogue: Discussing pros and cons of a topic.

lessons.title: Structuring Arguments
lessons.targetText: The evidence suggests... This leads us to conclude...
lessons.culturalNote: American academic style values clarity and evidence.

lessons.title: Idioms & Cultural References
lessons.targetText: It's not rocket science. Let's touch base later.
lessons.culturalNote: Understanding cultural references is key to native-like fluency.
